questions.subject: grammar
questions.question: Which sentence is grammatically correct?
questions.discussion: "Had broke" is incorrect grammar. The correct past tense of "break" is "broke" or "broken". "Has broken down" is the present perfect tense, which indicates that the car is no longer broken down. "Was broken down" is the past tense, which indicates that the car was broken down in the past. "Is broke down" is incorrect grammar. The correct present tense of "break" is "breaks".

questions.subject: grammar
questions.question: Which sentence uses the correct form of the verb "to be"?
questions.discussion: "Is a red" is incorrect grammar. The correct present tense of "to be" with singular nouns is "is". "Is red" is the correct present tense of "to be" with singular nouns. "Be red" is incorrect grammar. The correct present tense of "to be" with singular nouns is "is". "Are red" is incorrect grammar. The correct present tense of "to be" with plural nouns is "are".

questions.subject: grammar
questions.question: I love to travel and ___ new places.
questions.discussion: "Explore" is the correct answer because it is the base form of the verb and is used after "love to." "Exploring" is incorrect because it is the present participle form of the verb. "Explores" is incorrect because it is the third person singular form of the verb. "Being explore" is incorrect because it is not a grammatically correct phrase.

questions.subject: grammar
questions.question: The book that I read yesterday was very ___
questions.discussion: "Interesting" is the correct answer because it is an adjective that describes the book. "Interested" is incorrect because it is the past participle form of the verb. "Interest" is incorrect because it is a noun. "Interests" is incorrect because it is the plural form of the noun.

questions.subject: written expression
questions.question: Which of the following sentences is grammatically correct and best describes a football player who is both skilled and physically strong?

choices.a: The player is fast and strong.

choices.b: The player is fast and powerfully.

choices.c: The player is fast and strength.

choices.d: The player is fast and powerful.

discussion.a: Incorrect because "strong" is an adjective and needs to be used in its adverb form "strongly" to modify the verb "is."
discussion.b: Incorrect because "powerfully" is not a standard English word.
discussion.c: Incorrect because "strength" is a noun and cannot be used to modify a verb.
